zone.line: As wonderful as on Creations day.—
A little better would he live, hadst thou
Not given him a glimpse of Heaven's light
Which he calls reason, & employs it only
To live more beastlily than any beast.
With reverence of your Worship be it spoken
He's like one of those long-legged grasshoppers
Who flits & jumps about, & sings for ever
The same old song i' the grass. There let him lie.
Plunging Burying his nose in every heap of dung.
Chorus
Thy countenance gives the Angels strength
Though none can comprehend thee:
And all thy lofty works
Are excellent as at the first day. -
=== Such
This is a literal translation of this
astonishing chorus; it is impossible to
represent in another language the
melody of the versification; even the
volatile strength & delicacy of the ideas
& the reader is surprised
escape in the crucible of translation,
to find a caput mortuum.
